intro: Onosma hispida, commonly known as the hairy onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense spikes, typically blooming in summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
